ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] patch messed up my sound in EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: I suppose that things can go to hell in handbasket next month, but for now, I m really pleased that I m on Innorruuk.  Our planes scheduling system works very
ygData.messageBody:
I suppose that things can go to hell in handbasket next month, but for now, I'm really pleased that I'm on
Innorruuk. Our planes scheduling system works very well (see www.innoruuk.com if you're interested), and
the larger guilds seem to be cooperating rather nicely on giving each other shots at the big MOBs. After
taking VS on Thursday post-first-patch, my guild could have camped there to take him again after the next
patch, for example, but we knew that Pantheon wanted a shot, so we left (grats on crushing him, btw) and
took Phinny instead :) There are a lot of servers where that wouldn't have happened. On Innorruuk, we
would have been way out of line to try it. Yeah, there are times when two guilds show up for the same
MOB, and it stinks to be the one that doesn't get the shot, but for the most part things run pretty darn
well.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 54 songs, Innoruuk


James Schuldes wrote:

> Hrm, you guys got him Wed night - grats Jysa on the greaves.
>
> Silent Justice got him Thursday afternoon-ish right before the server went
> down. Heard that 2 staves dropped.
>
> The Pantheon (us ;) got him Thursday night right after the servers came back
> up. Druid drawers & Pally pants - Grats Tiana & Atreides.
>
> Inny is now pretty crowded again at the mid 50 level - damn waiting lists
> for the big names and races to rare spawns. Ok, well not exactly waiting
> lists but lots of folks able to do the < VP 'biggies.' And the damn
> scheduling for the planes and the quest loot there is making for some
> strange alliance - uber-guilds who never helped others are now begging for
> slots in small guild's plane runs just for the chance to get quest loots.
> Strange days indeed.
>
> Sylly
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kenneth E. Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 16, 2000 7:17 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] patch messed up my sound in EQ
>
> We managed to kill VS last night (for the first time as a guild), despite
> the bouncing HP problem.
> Although it really ticked off the Clerics. He dropped Bard pants! (I
> didn't get them, but I moved up to
> first in line.)
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 54 songs, Innoruuk
